test_id_1.query_content: When did redetrmination begin for the COVID-19 Public Health Emergency unwind in New York State

top_k_chunks.text:
9

Unwinding from the COVID-19 Public Health Emergency:
New York State Department of Health Shares Strategy to Help
Consumers Maintain Coverage
In early 2020, the United States Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) declared a Public Health
Emergency (PHE) in response to the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic, allowing New York
(NY) residents enrolled in Medicaid, Child Health Plus (CHP), and the Essential Plan (EP) to keep their
coverage without requiring an annual eligibility review.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update June 2022 Volume 38 Number 7
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
9

Unwinding from the COVID-19 Public Health Emergency:
New York State Department of Health Shares Strategy to Help
Consumers Maintain Coverage
In early 2020, the United States Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) declared a Public Health
Emergency (PHE) in response to the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic, allowing New York
(NY) residents enrolled in Medicaid, Child Health Plus (CHP), and the Essential Plan (EP) to keep their
coverage without requiring an annual eligibility review.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update June 2022 Volume 38 Number 7
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
3

Public Health Emergency Unwind
The Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2023 required states to begin the process of redetermining Medicaid
eligibility for its members, which New York State (NYS) began in April 2023.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update February 2025 Volume 41 Number 2
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
3

Public Health Emergency Unwind
The Consolidated Appropriations Act of 2023 required states to begin the process of redetermining Medicaid
eligibility for its members, which New York State (NYS) began in April 2023.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update February 2025 Volume 41 Number 2
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
Since inception of the PTPE process, the eMedNY “COVID
FAQs” web page, located at: https://www.emedny.org/COVID19/FAQ/, has stated: “Within six months of the
federal public health emergency being lifted, New York State will cease payments to providers who are
temporarily enrolled unless a provider has submitted an application that meets all requirements for New York
State Medicaid participation, and the application was reviewed and approved by the New York State
Department of Health within six months of the federal public health emergency being lifted.”
Providers who temporarily enrolled via the PTPE process must complete the full enrollment process by
November 11, 2023, to continue participation in the program.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update May 2023 Volume 39 Number 10
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
February 2023
Volume 39 | Number 3
Special Edition
Comprehensive Guidance Regarding Use of Telehealth including
Telephonic Services After the Coronavirus Disease 2019 Public
Health Emergency
Updates are highlighted in yellow
This guidance is intended to clarify the New York State (NYS) Medicaid program telehealth policy, including
use of audio-only technology, following the federally declared Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Public
Health Emergency (PHE), which ends on May 11, 2023.
top_k_chunks.title: Medicaid Update Special Edition Part Two: NYRx Pharmacy Benefit Transition Medicaid Update Volume 39 Number 1
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
Background
In order to better understand NYS health care provider perspectives on telehealth during and after the
Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) public health emergency (PHE), NYS DOH conducted the Telehealth
Provider Survey, which was active from August 2023 to October 2023.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update March 2024 Volume 40 Number 3
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
9

Pharmacy
New York State Medicaid Pharmacy Policy
for Coronavirus Disease 2019 Testing
Effective October 1, 2024, with the expiration of the Public Health Emergency (PHE) and provisions in the
American Rescue Plan Act (ARPA), NYRx, the New York State (NYS) Medicaid Pharmacy program, will no
longer provide coverage for Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) testing when administered in a pharmacy
or dispensed as a kit for at-home use.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update August 2024 Volume 40 Number 8
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

[mu_no3_feb23_speced_pr.pdf:1 — February 2023]

top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:

top_k_chunks.text:

appended with the GQ modifier to indicate the service was provided via audio-only (telephonic) telehealth.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update November 2021 Volume 37 Number 13
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
FQHCs That Have Not "Opted Into" APGs - FQHC Originating Sites:
a. Consistent with Medicaid telehealth guidance issued in February 2019, when services are
provided via telemedicine to a patient located at an FQHC originating site, the originating site
may bill only the FQHC off-site services rate code (“4012”) to recoup administrative expenses
associated with the telemedicine encounter. b. When a separate and distinct medical service, unrelated to the telemedicine encounter, is
provided by a qualified practitioner at the FQHC originating site, the originating site may bill
the Prospective Payment System (PPS) rate in addition to the FQHC off-site services rate code
(“4012”).
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update June 2021 Volume 37 Number 7
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
The prescription
must be for:
• a single instance of emergency medical care or order for one Medicaid member over a 180-day
period, or
• multiple instances of care provided to one Medicaid member when the services provided are more
readily available in another State over a 180-day period; and
• the NPI of the prescriber must be entered on the claim form; and
• the claim represents an item provided; and
• the claim represents services covered under the NYS Medicaid program; and
• based upon the prescription, the item is furnished by a pharmacy, pursuant to a prescription written
by an individual practitioner in an institutional setting at an OOS practice location (i.e., located outside
the geographical boundaries of the NYS Medicaid program).

top_k_chunks.text:
May 2021
Volume 37 | Number 6
Medicaid Pharmacy Carve-Out:
Delayed to April 1, 2023
As modified by the State Fiscal Year (SFY) 2022 Enacted Budget, the transition of the New York State
(NYS) Medicaid pharmacy benefit from Medicaid Managed Care (MMC) to the Fee-for-Service (FFS)
Program (i.e., the Pharmacy Carve-Out) has been delayed until April 1, 2023.

test_id_10.query_content: what are the requirements for a referral for enrollment in the childrens waiver?

top_k_chunks.text:
Referring a Child who is not Enrolled in Medicaid for HCBS Eligibility Determination
To obtain a Referral Packet, which is used to collect information about the child’s medical history and includes
consent forms, instructions, and general information about children’s HCBS, providers and individuals should
call C-YES at: 1-833-333-CYES (1-833-333-2937) or toll-free at 1-888-329-1541.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update March 2019 Volume 35 Number 4
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text: The letter also details the referral process.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update April 2023 Volume 39 Number 8
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
of the enrollee for implementation details,
predictable quality of life in childhood.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update September 2024 Volume 40 Number 10
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text: Written consent is required.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update November 2024 Volume 40 Number 12
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health

top_k_chunks.text:
12

Medicaid fee-for-service (FFS) will require prior authorization (PA) for most medically necessary therapy visits,
unless the member receiving the service meets one or more of the criteria listed below:
• Children from birth to age 21 (until their 21st birthday)
• Members with developmental disabilities (members with restriction/exception code "95" on file)
• Members with a traumatic brain injury (TBI) [members with TBI* (use procedure code modifier ST on
claims) or restriction/exception code "81" on file]
• Members with both Medicare Part B and Medicaid (dually eligible) when the service is covered by
Medicare
• Members receiving rehabilitation services as a hospital inpatient
• Members receiving rehabilitation services in a nursing home in which they reside
• Members receiving rehabilitation services provided by a certified home health agency (CHHA)
*TBI as defined in Public Health Law Article 27-cc: §2741.
top_k_chunks.title: New York State Medicaid Update April 2021 Volume 37 Number 5
top_k_chunks.authority: New York State Department of Health
